Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Tonya Love, former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife, failed to qualify for the council race earlier this month because she hadn’t gathered enough signatures. To qualify, a candidate needs to gather and submit at least 50 valid signatures; the registrar approved only 47 for Love.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The Alameda County Registrar of Voters is responsible for verifying and approving candidate signatures for the ballot.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The county attorneys countered in a brief that the state election code deems signatures on a nomination form invalid if they don’t include a signature and a printed name and if the address of the candidate’s supporter is not consistent with their voter registration form.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The county attorneys provided a legal brief countering Love's petition, citing the state election code.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “While we are disappointed by the court’s decision not to place us on the ballot in November, I remain undeterred in my commitment to serving Oakland and our communities,” she wrote. “My dedication to our city does not begin nor end with a campaign. There are many ways to effect change and ensure our voices are heard. I will continue to work alongside each of you, advocating for public health, safety, and equitable development in Oakland.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Tonya Love is a candidate for the District 7 council seat and has a history of political involvement in Oakland.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Judge Markman said that it appeared that the county registrar, Tim Dupuis, didn’t do “anything wrong” in this instance.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Judge Markman presided over the case and provided a ruling on the petition.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: In an interview with The Oaklandside last week, Newton was resigned to his failure to gather enough signatures–he picked up 37–but said he would work with whoever came out ahead in the race to help improve the community.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Nephew of Black Panther Party founder Huey Newton
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: David Newton attempted to run for the District 7 seat and shared his perspective on the race.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group, said in their petition that Love had gathered 67 signatures in total and that three of the signatures were unfairly disqualified.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Kaufman Legal Group represents Tonya Love and filed the petition on her behalf.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The message was cheered on by several community members and organizations such as the East Oakland Collective nonprofit.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: The East Oakland Collective is a nonprofit organization that supported Tonya Love's campaign.
